location.merchant_description_html: “Hey Josh!” Josh is our favorite banker. He’s known the family who owns the place since they opened 10 years ago! He needs rich, strong coffee for his morning meetings. He’s always gets his joe-to-go with a bagel. “Morning, Sara!” Sara, on the other hand is a lounge-er. She initially came for the sunny, communal vibe...but she stayed for the Huevos Rancheros! Sara is a frequent victim of food envy and always tries to change her order last-minute. She’s a spicy one... “So, how about you? I don’t think we’ve met. I’m Cafe La Taza.”

Sara is a frequent victim of food envy and always tries to change her order last-minute. She’s a spicy one... “So, how about you? I don’t think we’ve met. I’m Cafe La Taza.”

We have exciting news: Chris Harris has got your cover....covered! Glamlife Thursdays. Epic Saturdays. Hot Mess Sundays. Though you may not know it, all of the fabulous gay nightlife events are brought to you by Chris Harris Presents! Pay with LevelUp at the door and you’ll get $10 worth of your cover charge paid for. Continue to pay with LevelUp every time you attend a Chris Harris Presents event and you can earn additional cover-free nights! Hit Liquor Store (25 Boylston Place) for Glamlife Thursdays, Guilt Nightclub (75 Warrenton Street) for "Queer" Fridays, The House of Blues (15 Lansdowne Street) for Epic Saturdays or Underbar (275 Tremont Street) for Hot Mess Sundays!

location.street_address: 15 Landsdowne St. (Epic @ The House of Blues Boston)

Brownstone Bagel and Bread Co makes its bagels the old-fashioned way. That is, the shop's bagels aren't produced by a machine or spit out by a 3D printer, but hand-rolled into their thick, not-entirely-perfect shape. They're dipped into a boiling malt solution, and then placed on a stone hearth to bake. This labor of love, combined with high-quality flour, gives Brownstone's bagels the chewy consistency that New York bagels are famous for. Not surprisingly, the shop makes its own specialty spreads from scratch, too, including cured gravlox. It also dishes out other fresh roast Turkey, including egg sandwiches, fruit salads, and freshly squeezed orange juice.
location.name: Brownstone Bagels & Bread CO

location.merchant_description_html: Reading Terminal Market, you’ve done it again. This time you’ve caught the Golden Fish Market in your net. Here, the counter is filled with a sea of seasonal seafood possibilities. The friendly staff will greet you and guide you on your journey to a delicious meal. Try Sea Bass for a fancy dinner for your boss? Maybe Mackerel for a date-night dinner? The variety is endless. Fresh. Frozen. Fish. Crab. Squid. Ask for a recommendation, and Golden Fish will be happy to send you on your way with a wrapped delight.

They say The Bellevue Mall is a safe area, but I beg to differ. The Gourmet Food Court is inside. This means shopping trips are dangerously close to Ellen’s Bagels, Hoagies and More. Instead of returning home with clothes, I’m usually toting an armful of South Street Philly Bagels. While admiring handbags I’m overcome with a desire for a chicken Ellen, loaded with grilled chicken, sharp provolone, hot peppers and their secret house dressing. Diamonds and clothes used to be a girl’s best friend. But that was before Ellen arrived.

After a whirlwind workout with your personal trainer at Club Fitness, you need a refresher from the in-gym Shake Bar. Before you buy tanning oil and finish your visit at their tanning salon, head over for a drink. A friendly barista will blend up the perfect mix of high quality protein powder and fresh ingredients. Choose Chocolate Peanut Butter for a sweet punch or the fruity Banana Bonita. With 50 flavors, performance drinks, supplements and smoothies on the menu, you can switch it up after every workout. So take a sip to quench those burning muscles.

Naturally Delicious is the Financial District’s on-the-go healthy spot. In comparison to the rest of NYC, it stands out. Skyscrapers? Unnatural. A Chicken Waldorf Salad with fresh apples, walnuts, and greens? Totally natural. A city that glows, even at night? That ain’t heaven’s light. A juicy ½ lb. Cheeseburger Deluxe? Nature’s gift. Tasty fare with a pure flare is just what you need. Your razor-sharp business sense will take you to the top, so celebrate with a natural Vanilla Smoothie. Victory is sweet.

Like most people, I am looking for the ONE. In a fast food world, it’s hard to find a good fit. But at Life Alive, there’s no shortage of vegetarian choices. The Adventurer plate tempts me with broccoli crowns, roasted almonds and chopped beets over brown rice. I blush when it flashes its melted cheddar. Then I see her: The Udon Miso Masterful. Her thick, comforting Udon noodles mingle with shredded carrots and shitake mushrooms in what can only be described as "power soup." She’s different. I enjoy her with a Thrive Alive Juice, a delicious mixture of apple, ginger and carrot and an anti-oxidant rich Love Alive Smoothie for dessert. Now, it’s clear. Life Alive is the ONE.

The Bagels at Spread are made the old world Montreal way. Not sure what “the Montreal way” is, ay? It means that each bagel is hand rolled, boiled in honey water then baked in a small batch in America’s first wood fired Montreal bagel brick oven! This process is perfect for their signature Everything Bagels. Hot and heavily seeded, that’s how Canada...I mean Philly does breakfast!
The Spread doesn’t end there. Saturday and Sunday’s all-day brunch is a BYOV extravaganza. You’re provided a shaker of the house Spicy Bloody Mary Mix, veggies and two glasses. Bagels and B-Marys? Call Canada, they’re going to want in on this.

Zio’s Pizzeria may be in Center City, but the reality is that it’s the center of my pizza universe. A glimmer of saucy hope. A beacon that declares that Philly can make great pizza, too. The cheesy, veggie, meaty goodness of The Works pizza speaks volumes. Shrimp Scampi and Chicken Fajita grace pizza slices with flavorful gusto. Opening acts like Mozzarella Cheese Fries and the flame-broiled Bacon Cheeseburger put on a show. When all is said and done, I’ve got stars in my eyes and pizza in my stomach.

Looking for a great place for breakfast and lunch? Look no further than Cafe Green! Enjoy a Latte and creamy Yogurt with Fig Preserves and Honey while you work on the WiFi. Stop in for a quick midday meal and order the Crudites Sandwich. This healthy sandwich is stuffed with veggies like avocado and carrots, and drizzled with olive oil and balsamic vinaigrette. Whatever you choose, be sure to add on one (or four!) macaroons. Indulge in the Pistachio, or be bold and enjoy an Earl Grey. This affordable café is the perfect addition to your day!

Cafe La Boheme has been a neighborhood gem since 1975. People pop in for breakfast on-the-go and grab La Mission Desayuno with eggs, salsa, and pepper jack baked in a flour tortilla. As the day goes on, locals settle into familiar activities: Playing chess. Observing the funky art. Chatting over Cappuccinos. As the sun sets, swap your mug for a beer. Pair your brew with a Panini and a bowl of Lentil Soup. A perfect end to a perfect day. Cafe La Boheme feels like the Mission, and the Mission feels like home.

Cafe Ponte’s fresh baked pastries are on point! The enormous glass case houses over-sized Blueberry Muffins, loaded Cranberry Scones and homemade Chocolate Chip Cookies. But the biggest score comes in the form of the Apple Pie, which is served in huge hunks, topped with granola and nuts. Under the crunchy surface is layer upon layer of fresh, halved apples! Once you’ve conquered pastry case 101, we’ll let you move on to the full serve breakfast and lunch menu! Hot Tip: Want your sweet treat with a side of free wifi? Look no further than the portrait of Carmella Ponte on the wall behind the door. She holds the key to your Internet connection!

I dip my spoon into the rich Tomato Basil Bisque at Bread and Cocoa. Suddenly, this moment seems entirely Glee-worthy. I push my soup aside, stand on my table and belt out, “Don’t stop! Believin’! This soup is what I’m feeeelin’!” Then just like the show, everyone joins in. “Chocolate ganache in the cocoa, oooh oh!” People pick up their organic egg Sandwiches and fresh Salads and dance in unison. The choreography is excellent. When the song is over, I sit and take another sip of soup. Yup, it’s that good.

Cafe De Boston is an all-purpose cafeteria for the “die hahhd” professional in Boston. When your feathers are ruffled from an episode of downtown parking wars, we’ve got two words for you: oatmeal bar. Served with fresh toppings like fruit, granola and almonds, the stuff is known to cure even the most severe cases of commute rage. When you’ve got 5 minutes to turn an afternoon meeting into a birthday celebration, Cafe De Boston also has your back with beautifully decorated cakes to make you look like the golden co-worker. And when the wind whips through the financial district and you need something to make you feel whole again, hit the build-a-bowl pasta station. With Cafe De Boston in their arsenal, the tie and pencil skirt crowd is bound to conquer!

The chefs at Stone Hearth Pizza have mastered the chew, crunch, char ratio in the thin crust of their Neapolitan style pizza, but the crust is not the only star in this oven. The sweet signature sauce, made with organic tomatoes mingles with the cheese and toppings in what we call a “crave-worthy collaboration.” Plus, a slice of this savory pie is just as good for your health as it is for your taste buds. The fresh, organic ingredients are sourced from 30 New England farms and businesses! Round up your family and friends and grab a seat at the table...there’s a fresh pizza with your name on it!

I fell in love with AnyTime Pizza over a slice of Thai Pizza. The harmony of spicy chicken is offset by the cool crunch of carrots, bean sprouts and the cut of peanut sauce. I got down on one knee. AnyTime Pizza, if you’ll be my lawfully wedded pizza joint, I promise to let you have the last bite of my Angus Burger at dinner. If I could wake up to your beautiful egg-laden Breakfast Pizza every morning, I’d be a lucky man. I promise to bring home the dough so we can have a stable life. Your crust is the only one for me.

It took us time to master The Sandwich. George Foreman rose a god with a grill and the panini. But soon, bread building bored us. Things have changed: Great Wraps is the new king, serving the best wraps with succulent deli meats and fresh veggies, pick-n-choose style. Peer through the glass window at jewels of crispy veggies for your selection. Feeling uncreative? Peep the full menu: from the Almond Chicken Melt to the Falafel Hummus Wrap. Don’t leave without Kurly Fries and a pit stop at the 6-spice bar!

Panini, sweet sandwich shop, I’ve loved you since the first time I bit into the flavorful goodness of your creamy Mozzarella Basil Panini. And then today you placed a masterpiece onto my plate: Nichole’s Panini. Turkey is tucked into a buttered slice of sourdough. Harvardi cheese and bacon pair perfectly with tomato and avocado to create the most salivating sandwich I’ve ever eaten. Then you surprise me with a salad, sprinkled in to-die-for vinaigrette. Mmm… I love you. Now can I please try the Tofunini?

At Pork Store Cafe, they know what the mighty piggy is capable of. The Ham Omelet rises as a savory beacon of what breakfast should be. With a crisped side of Hash Browned Potatoes, it’s perfect. Vegetarians delight in the Scralifornia: a mix of scrambled eggs, avo, feta and fresh salsa. Good news is, the Mission’s Pork Store keeps its doors open ‘til 3 AM on weekends. So when you get a late-night foody call for a Porky’s Burger with blue cheese, answer it. The pig doesn’t like to be kept waiting.

Step into Ben & Jerry’s, an oasis of ice cream euphoria. The scent of homemade waffle cones lingers in the air. The tie-die decor swirls over the walls, tables and floors, creating a tempting trail to the main event, the ice cream! All of your favorites are chillin’ behind the glass: Cherry Garcia, Milk & Cookies and Chocolate Therapy. There’s even a few fresh flavors to sample: What a Cluster (a peanut buttery delight) and Schweddy Balls (Vanilla loaded with Rum & Malt balls!) With such a sweet menu, the decision will be tough. Don’t forget about the sundaes, smoothies, shakes and cakes!

We called this coffee intervention today to help you. Your view of coffee as a caffeine vessel is undelicious and troubling. Try a rich cup from Jebena. Do you see the life of flavor you’ve got ahead of you? Think of all the Masala Chai and fragrant Ethiopian blends of Espresso you haven’t tried! Your taste buds, reformed from bland coffee abuse, can fully savor locally-made Chocolate Hazelnut Gelato. A barista will even support you through the brew selection process. Be strong, my friend. Like a good cup of joe.

Tantalize your taste buds without breaking your bank account. Naan -N- Curry chefs shepherd traditional Indian and Pakistani dishes onto suspecting (and excited) San-Franciscan plates. This affordable and vast buffet lures the masses to savor the spiced flavors of Eastern cuisine. Friendly staffers keep you comfortable while each bite stimulates your palette. The Naan’s soft and warm, the atmosphere’s alive and inviting, and the Tandoori is the clay-cooked favorite at all four locations.

Kendall Square, your cool-factor has finally arrived in the form of Firebrand Saints. Though the bar has just opened, the bartenders are well seasoned. Down a Whiskey Smash or tap the beer menu for a Fuller’s ESB from London. If you work up an appetite, score a seat at a truck hood table and order a Steak Tartare Burger. The charred yet juicy burger pairs perfectly with the fresh a la carte toppings, which by the way are totally worth the $1-$2 charge. With places like FS popping up, people might stop saying “Let’s go downtown tonight,” and start saying “Meet you in Cambridge?”
